body:
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/blob/f25a169c4c0943b34777a306e93d8fbefc9d8109/lib/connections/structs.go#L127-L137

I wonder if it's simply caused by the transport listening on `[::]` ? Switching to `c.RemoteAddr()` should solve that.
Looks like `LocalAddr()` provides only the unresolved address we're listening on?
@marten-seemann we're using `LocalAddr()` as provided by quic-go's `Connection` interface as far as I can see.
So we switch to using the remote address? No need to investigate much deeper, imho.
From our project's perspective, yes. This still looks like a bug to me, which, if correct, should be fixed upstream.
Maybe? Do other "regular" sockets behave differently? For UDP I think this might be expected regardless of what QUIC does.

issue.title: lib/connections: fix transport type detection for QUIC

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

Fixes #8274

The actual local address is not resolved for a QUIC connection, and will always report what we've passed to the listener. A dual-stack enabled host would simply return `[::]:xxxxx`, which is interpreted as `quic6`.

The remote address doesn't suffer from this problem.

### Testing

https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/8274#issuecomment-1722490987

## Authorship

Your name and email will be added automatically to the AUTHORS file
based on the commit metadata.

issue.title: Default listener only sends ULA addresses to Discovery, global addresses are not sent

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Does your log mention database corruption?
No.

### Include required information

Please be sure to include at least:

 - v1.25.0, Linux (64-bit Intel/AMD)
 - when using the "default" listener then only ULA addresses are sent to the discovery service.
 - when entering "tcp6://[20ad:123:234::1]:22000" then this IP is sent to the discovery service.
 - tested with https://discovery.syncthing.net/?device=(id)

This makes IPv6 connections over the internet impossible.
